title: Getting Started with Server-Side Programming in Node.js
author: Sarah Developer
content: In this beginner-friendly guide, Sarah Developer introduces you to the world of server-side programming in Node.js. You'll learn the basics of setting up a Node.js server, handling HTTP requests, and building simple APIs. Whether you're a seasoned developer looking to expand your skill set or a newcomer to programming, this post will get you started on the right path.

title: Creating RESTful APIs with Express in Node.js
author: John Coder
content: John Coder takes you on a deep dive into creating RESTful APIs using the Express framework in Node.js. This post covers routing, middleware, request handling, and error management. By the end of this read, you'll be well-equipped to build robust and scalable APIs for your applications.

title: Scaling Node.js Servers with Load Balancing
author: Lisa Engineer
content: In this advanced post, Lisa Engineer discusses strategies for scaling Node.js servers to handle increased traffic and load. You'll explore load balancing techniques, clustering, and deploying Node.js applications in production environments. If you're running or planning to run high-traffic applications, this post is a must-read to ensure the reliability and performance of your server-side code.
